name: File
shortdesc: Represents a file in the local file system in a platform-independent manner.

method.name: File
method.shortdesc: Creates and returns a new File object referring to a given file system location.

parameter.name: path
parameter.shortdesc: The full or partial path name of the file,  in platform-specific or URI format.

li: The File function returns a Folder object instead of a File object.
The new operator returns a File object for a nonexisting file with the same name.

property.name: fs
property.shortdesc: The name of the file system.
property.description: This is a class property accessed through the File constructor. Valid values are "Windows", "Macintosh", and "Unix".

method.name: encode
method.shortdesc: Encodes a string as required by RFC 2396, and returns the encoded string.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The string to encode.

method.name: decode
method.shortdesc: Decodes a UTF-8 encoded string as required by RFC 2396, and returns the decoded string.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.shortdesc: The UTF-8 encoded string to decode.

method.name: isEncodingAvailable
method.shortdesc: Reports whether a given encoding is available.

parameter.name: name
parameter.shortdesc: The encoding name.

method.name: openDialog
method.shortdesc: Opens a dialog so the user can select one or more files to open.

li: If the user clicks OK, returns a File object for the selected file, or an array of objects if multiple files are selected.
If the user cancels, returns null.

parameter.name: prompt
parameter.shortdesc: The prompt text, displayed if the dialog allows a prompt.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.shortdesc: A filter that limits the types of files displayed in the dialog.

li: In Windows,  a filter expression such as "Javascript files:*.jsx;All files:*.*".
In Mac OS, a filter function that takes a File instance and returns true if the file should be included in the display, false if it should not.

parameter.name: multiSelect
parameter.shortdesc: When true, the user can select multiple files and the return value is an array.

method.name: saveDialog
method.shortdesc: Opens a dialog so the user can select a file name to save to.

li: If the user clicks OK, returns a File object for the selected file location.
If the user cancels, returns null.

parameter.name: prompt
parameter.shortdesc: The prompt text, displayed if the dialog allows a prompt.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.shortdesc: In Windows only, a filter that limits the types of files displayed in the dialog.
parameter.description: In Windows only,  a filter expression such as "Javascript files:*.jsx;All files:*.*". Not used In Mac OS.

property.name: alias
property.shortdesc: If true, the object refers to a file system alias or shortcut.

property.name: created
property.shortdesc: The creation date of the referenced file, or null if the object does not refer to a file on disk.

property.name: error
property.shortdesc: A string containing a message describing the most recent file system error.
property.description: Typically set by the file system, but a script can set it. Setting this value clears any error message and resets the error bit for opened files. Contains the empty string if there is no error.

property.name: exists
property.shortdesc: If true, this object refers to a file or file-system alias that actually exists in the file system.

property.name: fsName
property.shortdesc: The platform-specific full path name for the referenced file.

property.name: fullName
property.shortdesc: The full path name for the referenced file in URI notation.

property.name: absoluteURI
property.shortdesc: The full path name for the referenced file in URI notation.

property.name: relativeURI
property.shortdesc: The path name for the object in URI notation, relative to the current folder.

property.name: modified
property.shortdesc: The date of the referenced file's last modification, or null if the object does not refer to a file on the disk.

property.name: name
property.shortdesc: The file name portion of the absolute URI for the referenced file, without the path specification.

property.name: displayName
property.shortdesc: The localized name of the referenced file, without the path specification.

property.name: path
property.shortdesc: The path portion of the absolute URI for the referenced file, without the file name.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: The Folder object for the folder that contains this file.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The file type as a four-character string.

li: In Mac OS, the Mac OS file type.
In Windows, "appl" for .EXE files, "shlb" for .DLL files and "TEXT" for any other file.

property.name: creator
property.shortdesc: In Mac OS, the file creator as a four-character string. In Windows or UNIX, value is "????".

property.name: hidden
property.shortdesc: When true, the file is not shown in the platform-specific file browser.
property.description: If the object references a file-system alias or shortcut, the flag is altered on the alias, not on the original file.

property.name: readonly
property.shortdesc: When true, prevents the file from being altered or deleted.
property.description: If the referenced file is a file-system alias or shortcut, the flag is altered on the alias, not on the original file.

property.name: lineFeed
property.shortdesc: How line feed characters are written in the file system.

property.name: length
property.shortdesc: The size of the file in bytes.
property.description: Can be set only for a file that is not open, in which case it truncates or pads the file with 0-bytes to the new length.

property.name: encoding
property.shortdesc: Gets or sets the encoding for subsequent read/write operations.

property.name: eof
property.shortdesc: When true, a read attempt caused the current position to be at the end of the file, or the file is not open.

method.name: resolve
method.shortdesc: Attempts to resolve the file-system alias or shortcut that this object refers to.
method.description: If successful, creates and returns a new File object that points to the resolved file system element. Returns null if this object does not refer to an alias, or if the alias could not be resolved.

method.name: rename
method.shortdesc: Renames the associated file.
method.description: Does not resolve aliases, but renames the referenced alias or shortcut file itself. Returns true if the file was successfully renamed.

parameter.name: newName
parameter.shortdesc: The new file name, with no path information.

method.name: remove
method.shortdesc: Deletes the file associated with this object from disk immediately, without moving it to the system trash.

description.li: IMPORTANT: Cannot be undone. It is recommended that you prompt the user for permission before deleting.

method.name: changePath
method.shortdesc: Changes the path specification of the referenced file.

parameter.name: path
parameter.shortdesc: A string containing the new path, absolute or relative to the current folder.

method.name: getRelativeURI
method.shortdesc: Retrieves and returns the path for this file, relative to the specified base path, in URI notation.
method.description: If no base path is supplied, the URI is relative to the path of the current folder.  Returns a string containing the relative URI.

parameter.name: basePath
parameter.shortdesc: A base path in URI notation.

method.name: execute
method.shortdesc: Executes or opens this file using the appropriate application, as if it had been double-clicked in a file browser.

method.name: openDlg
method.shortdesc: Opens the built-in platform-specific file-browsing dialog, in which the user can select an existing file or files, and creates new File objects to represent the selected files.

li: If the user clicks OK, returns a File or Folder object for the selected file or folder, or an array of objects.
If the user cancels, returns null.

parameter.name: prompt
parameter.shortdesc: A string containing the prompt text, if the dialog allows a prompt.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.shortdesc: A filter that limits the types of files displayed in the dialog.

li: In Windows,  a filter expression such as "Javascript files:*.jsx;All files:*.*".
In Mac OS, a filter function that takes a File instance and returns true if the file should be included in the display, false if it should not.

parameter.name: multiSelect
parameter.shortdesc: When true, the user can select multiple files and the return value is an array.

method.name: saveDlg
method.shortdesc: Opens the built-in platform-specific file-browsing dialog, in which the user can select an existing file location to which to save information, and creates a new File object to represent the selected file.

li: If the user clicks OK, returns a File object for the selected file.
If the user cancels, returns null.

parameter.name: prompt
parameter.shortdesc: A string containing the prompt text, if the dialog allows a prompt.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.shortdesc: In Windows only, a filter that limits the types of files displayed in the dialog.
parameter.description: In Windows only,  a filter expression such as "Javascript files:*.jsx;All files:*.*". Not used In Mac OS.

method.name: toString
method.shortdesc: Converts this object to a string.

method.name: toSource
method.shortdesc: Creates and returns a serialized string representation of this object.

method.name: createAlias
method.shortdesc: Makes this file a file-system alias or shortcut to the specified file.
method.description: The referenced file for this object must not yet exist on disk. Returns true if the operation was successful.

parameter.name: path
parameter.shortdesc: A string containing the path of the target file.

method.name: open
method.shortdesc: Opens the referenced file for subsequent read/write operations. The method resolves any aliases to find the file.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.shortdesc: The read-write mode, a single-character string.

li: r &#40;read) Opens for reading. If the file does not exist or cannot be found, the call fails.
w &#40;write) Opens a file for writing. If the file exists, its contents are destroyed. If the file does not exist, creates a new, empty file.
e &#40;edit) Opens an existing file for reading and writing.
a &#40;append) Opens an existing file for reading and writing, and moves the current position to the end of the file.

parameter.name: type
parameter.shortdesc: In Mac OS, the type of a newly created file, a 4-character string. Ignored in Windows and UNIX.

parameter.name: creator
parameter.shortdesc: In Mac OS, the creator of a newly created file, a 4-character string. Ignored in Windows and UNIX.

method.name: close
method.shortdesc: Closes this open file.
method.description: Returns true if the file was closed successfully, false if an I/O error occurred.

method.name: read
method.shortdesc: Reads the contents of the file, starting at the current position.
method.description: Returns a string that contains up to the specified number of characters. If a number of characters is not supplied, reads from the current position to the end of the file. If the file is encoded, multiple bytes might be read to create single Unicode characters.

parameter.name: chars
parameter.shortdesc: An integer specifying the number of characters to read.

method.name: readch
method.shortdesc: Reads a single text character from the file at the current position.
method.description: Line feeds are recognized as CR, LF, CRLF or LFCR pairs.  If the file is encoded, multiple bytes might be read to create a single Unicode character. Returns a string that contains the character.

method.name: readln
method.shortdesc: Reads a single line of text from the file at the current position.
method.description: Line feeds are recognized as CR, LF, CRLF or LFCR pairs.. If the file is encoded, multiple bytes might be read to create single Unicode characters. Returns a string that contains the text.

method.name: write
method.shortdesc: Writes the specified text to the file at the current position.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: A text string to be written.

method.name: writeln
method.shortdesc: Writes a string to the file at the current position and appends a line-feed sequence.

parameter.name: text
parameter.shortdesc: A text string to be written.

method.name: seek
method.shortdesc: Seeks to a given position in the file.
method.description: The new position cannot be less than 0 or greater than the current file size. Returns true if the position was changed.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.shortdesc: The seek mode.

li: 0: Seek to absolute position, where pos=0 is the first byte of the file. This is the default.
1: Seek relative to the current position.
2. Seek backward from the end of the file.

method.name: tell
method.shortdesc: Retrieves the current position as a byte offset from the start of the file.
method.description: Returns a number, the position index.

method.name: copy
method.shortdesc: Copies this objectâ€™s referenced file to the specified target location.
method.description: Resolves any aliases to find the source file. If a file exists at the target location, it is overwritten.Returns true if the copy was successful.

parameter.name: target
parameter.shortdesc: A string with the URI path to the target location, or a File object that references the target location.
